main.commit_message:
Always use inline assembly for _xgetbv on GCC/Clang

This reverts the change to blosc/shuffle.c in
0b8608b5d12ca96d4ac4525b36a62062b2286fd4.

The _xgetbv intrinsic defined by GCC and Clang can only be used when
built with support for the xsave target feature.  Therefore,
attempting to use it from blosc_get_cpu_features results in a compiler
error:

error: inlining failed in call to 'always_inline' '_xgetbv': target specific option mismatch

On most platforms, the intrinsic was not being used because
immintrin.h was not getting transitively included in shuffle.c.  However, on
mingw64 it does get transitively included in shuffle.c, which leads to
the error.

In order to be able to use the intrinsic, it would need to be used
from a separate function that is built with xsave support.  That is
more complicated than just using the inline assembly version.

message_analysis.llama2-7b-chat: Based on the commit message you provided, I would categorize it as "Bug Fix".

main.commit_message:
Update to BSD 3-Clause license

These files still references the MIT license, which the project moved away
from in 2016. This commit changes the license to BSD 3-Clause, which the
file 'LICENSE.TXT' also refers to.

message_analysis.llama2-7b-chat: Based on the commit message you provided, I would categorize it as "Document Improvement".

message_analysis.llama2-7b-chat: Based on the commit message you provided, I would categorize it as "Bug Fix".

main.commit_message:
CMake: Modernize project statement

Support for handling CMP0048. Previously, when
set to NEW, a warning would be created that the
project string was missing the VERSION string.
Now instead, embrace that and include it always when available.

A fallback path for older CMake versions has been
created (using the previous call to project()).

message_analysis.llama2-7b-chat: Based on the provided commit message, I would categorize it as "Bug Fix". The commit message mentions "Previously, when set to NEW, a warning would be created that the project string was missing the VERSION string." which indicates that a bug or issue was fixed in the previous version of the project.

main.commit_message:
Fix CMake Processor Identification Logic

CMake string comparison would not work with CMake 3.24.2.
Thus, the if statement has been updated to use matches rather
than a bunch of STREQUAL which seems to work better.

message_analysis.llama2-7b-chat: Based on the commit message you provided, I would categorize it as "Bug Fix".
